alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 11 at 7:12PM MDT until June 11 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE EAST TROUBLESOME BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN GRAND COUNTY... At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated rain had ended over the East Troublesome Burn Scar. Up to 0.5 inches of rain may have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the East Troublesome Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the East Troublesome Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Grand County This includes the following additional locations... rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd, Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Drowsy Water Ranch and Elk Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
